Generation IV.Diamond: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
Generation IV.Platinum: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
Generation IV.HeartGold: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It flourished worldwide during the ice age but its population declined when the masses of ice began to dwindle.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
Generation VIII.Shield: It looks strong, and that's exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The ice age is over and the climate has warmed, so this Pokémon's population has thinned.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The ice age is over and the climate has warmed, so this Pokémon's population has thinned.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

Generation IX.Scarlet: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
Generation IX.Violet: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up, to much amazement.
